snippet: Negotiations ended between Daniel W. Jones, who had been ousted as chancellor of the University of Mississippi, and schools officials, who had proposed a 2017 retirement.
abstract: Daniel W Jones, former chancellor of the University of Mississippi, rejects offer to return for two-year term before 2017 retirement; Jones, whose forceful stands for racial tolerance helped shift views on campus, received outpouring of support and protest following his ouster; says he refuses to take part in lame-duck tenure.
lead_paragraph: Negotiations ended between Daniel W. Jones, who had been ousted as chancellor of the University of Mississippi, and schools officials, who had proposed a 2017 retirement.

headline.main: University of Mississippi Chief, Whose Ouster Led to Protests, Rejects Offer to Stay
headline.print_headline: University of Mississippi Chief, Whose Ouster Led to Protests, Rejects Offer to Stay
